name: GooglePlayRelease
description: Release an app to the Google Play Store
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: Service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Google Play service connection that is configured with your account credentials.

inputs.name: serviceAccountKey
inputs.label: JSON key path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The JSON file provided by Google Play that includes the service account's identity you wish to publish your APKs or AABs under.

inputs.name: applicationId
inputs.label: Application id (com.google.MyApp)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application id of APK or AAB you want to release, e.g. com.company.MyApp.

inputs.name: bundleFile
inputs.label: Bundle path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the bundle file you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.aab_ to match the first AAB file, in any directory.

inputs.name: apkFile
inputs.label: APK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the APK file you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.apk_ to match the first APK file, in any directory.

inputs.name: bundleFiles
inputs.label: Bundle paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: Paths to the bundle files you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.aab_ to match all AAB files, in any directory.

inputs.name: apkFiles
inputs.label: APK paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: Paths to the APK files you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.apk_ to match all APK files, in any directory.

inputs.name: shouldPickObbFile
inputs.label: Upload OBB for APK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to pick expansion file for the apk(s). If present in the parent directory, it will pick the first file with .obb extension, else it will pick from apk directory with expected format as main.<version code>.<package name>.obb

inputs.name: track
inputs.label: Track
inputs.helpMarkDown: Track you want to publish the apk(s)/aab(s) to.

inputs.name: shouldAttachMetadata
inputs.label: Update metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to update the metadata in fastlane format on your app release.

inputs.name: changeLogFile
inputs.label: Release notes (file)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the file specifying the release notes (change log) for the application you are publishing.

inputs.name: languageCode
inputs.label: Language code
inputs.helpMarkDown: An IETF language tag identifying the language of the release notes as specified in the BCP-47 document. Default value is _en-US_

inputs.name: metadataRootPath
inputs.label: Metadata root directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the metadata folder with the fastlane metadata structure.

inputs.name: changeUpdatePriority
inputs.label: Set in-app update priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change the in-app update priority value.

inputs.name: updatePriority
inputs.label: In-app Update Priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set a custom in-app update priority value to help keep your app up-to-date on your users' devices. To determine priority, Google Play uses an integer value between 0 and 5, with 0 being the default, and 5 being the highest priority. Priority can only be set when rolling out a new release, and cannot be changed later.

inputs.name: rolloutToUserFraction
inputs.label: Roll out release
inputs.helpMarkDown: Roll out the release to a percentage of users.

inputs.name: userFraction
inputs.label: Rollout fraction
inputs.helpMarkDown: The percentage of users the specified application will be released to for the specified 'Track'. It can be increased later with the 'Google Play - Increase Rollout' task.

inputs.name: shouldUploadMappingFile
inputs.label: Upload deobfuscation file (mapping.txt)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to attach your proguard mapping.txt file to your aab/apk.

inputs.name: mappingFilePath
inputs.label: Deobfuscation path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the proguard mapping.txt file to upload. Glob patterns are supported.
inputs.visibleRule: action != OnlyStoreListing && action != MultiApkAab && shouldUploadMappingFile = true

inputs.name: shouldUploadNativeDebugSymbols
inputs.label: Upload native debug symbols
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to attach your native debug symbols archive to your aab/apk.

inputs.name: nativeDebugSymbolsFile
inputs.label: Native debug symbols archive path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the native debug symbols (.zip) file to upload. Glob patterns are supported.
inputs.visibleRule: action != OnlyStoreListing && action != MultiApkAab && shouldUploadNativeDebugSymbols = true

inputs.name: changesNotSentForReview
inputs.label: Send changes to review
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to send changes for review in GooglePlay Console. If changes are already sent for review automatically, you shouldn't select this option. [More info](https://developers.google.com/android-publisher/api-ref/rest/v3/edits/commit#query-parameters).

inputs.name: releaseName
inputs.label: Release name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The release name is only for use in Play Console and won't be visible to users. To make your release easier to identify, add a release name that's meaningful to you.

inputs.name: versionCodeFilterType
inputs.label: Replace version codes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify version codes to replace in the selected track with the new aab(s)/apk(s): all, the comma separated list, or a regular expression pattern.

inputs.name: replaceList
inputs.label: Version code list
inputs.helpMarkDown: The comma separated list of version codes to be removed from the track with this deployment.

inputs.name: replaceExpression
inputs.label: Version code pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: The regular expression pattern to select a list of version codes to be removed from the track with this deployment, e.g. _.\*12?(3|4)?5_

inputs.name: isDraftRelease
inputs.label: Release as Draft
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows to create a draft release which can later be deployed via the Google Play Console.

messages.AttachingMetadataToRelease: Attempting to attach metadata to release...
messages.CannotCreateListing: Failed to create the localized %s store listing. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotDownloadTrack: Failed to download track %s information. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotReadChangeLog: Failed to read change log %s. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotUpdateTrack: Failed to update track %s information. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotUploadApk: Failed to upload the APK %s. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotUploadBundle: Failed to upload the bundle %s. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotUploadDeobfuscationFile: Failed to upload the deobfuscation file %s. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotUploadExpansionFile: Failed to upload the expansion file %s. Failed with message: %s.
messages.CannotUploadNativeDeobfuscationFile: Failed to upload the native debug symbols file %s. Failed with message: %s.
messages.GetNewEditAfterAuth: Authenticated with Google Play and getting new edit
messages.ImageDirNotFound: Image directory for %s was not found. Skipping...
messages.ImageTypeNotFound: Image for %s was not found. Skipping...
messages.IncorrectVersionCodeFilter: Version code list specified contains incorrect codes: %s
messages.InvalidActionInputValue: Action input value is invalid: $s. Please recheck pipeline task configuration.
messages.InvalidAuthFile: %s is not a valid auth file
messages.MustProvideApkIfObb: shouldPickObbFile input is enabled, but no apk files could be found
messages.MustProvideApkOrAab: You must provide either apk or aab file(s). Neither were found.
messages.SetUnusedInput: Input %s was set, but it will not be used in this action
messages.StatNotDirectory: Stat returned that %s was not a directory. Is there a file that shares this name?
messages.UploadingMetadataForLanguage: Attempting to upload metadata in %s for language code %s
